section.title: Set up Automatic Runtime Detection
section.para: JBoss Developer Studio has automatic runtime detection for finding runtime servers. This can be set up to scan locations for runtime servers when a new workspace is created or JBoss Developer Studio or Eclipse is started.
If you installed JBoss Developer Studio with the installer you may have already set this up during the installation process.

If you have not set this up or you installed JBoss Developer Studio though Eclipse Marketplace, to set automatic runtime detection follow these steps:
Click Window→Preferences.
Expand JBoss Tools and select JBoss Tools Runtime Detection.
To add a path for scanning, click Add and select a folder where recursive scanning should commence from. JBoss Developer Studio scans this folder to check if it does contain a new runtime server.
If new runtime servers are found, you can create instances of them. Select the check boxes of the runtime servers you want to create and click OK. If no runtime servers were found or you do not wish to create any instances click Cancel. In all cases, the path is added to the list of paths for scanning.
For the new path, select the Every start check box if you want this path to be scanned for runtime servers each time JBoss Developer Studio or Eclipse starts.
Click Apply to save any new paths and click OK to close the Preferences window.
